H0.text: Temperature is what Fahrenheit, Celsius, and Kelvin measure.

H1.text: Brightness is the quantity measured by Fahrenheit, Celsius, and Kelvin units.

H2.text: Radiation is what Fahrenheit, Celsius, and Kelvin are units that measure.

H3.text: Precipitation is measured by Fahrenheit, Celsius, and Kelvin units.

A4.text: Celsius, Kelvin, and Fahrenheit are common temperature scales.

A5.text: The Kelvin scale defines the SI base unit of thermodynamic temperature with symbol K.
